p: Carotenoids have immunoregulatory actions including reducing free radicals [ 39] and pro-inflammatory molecules, such as IL-2 and TNF-α. Moreover, vitamin A downregulates IFNγ production, an action which is more evident in a high oxidative stress environment [ 40]. Vitamin A is implicated in respiratory diseases since it plays a role in the formation of a healthy mucus layer [ 41] and its overt or subclinical deficiency increases morbidity and mortality from infections and respiratory diseases [ 41].
